Key Match Events: England slumped to a shock loss to Ireland as rain forced an early finish at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
England were 105 for five with 5.3 overs left when the rain came, leaving them stranded at five runs behind the Duckworth-Lewis (DL) par score.
Ireland produced a disciplined bowling performance to restrict England’s big hitters.
Josh Little had Alex Hales caught for seven with a miscued pull.
Ben Stokes was bowled for six by Fionn Hand.
Dawid Malan was dropped on 23 by Gareth Delany but later caught for 35 off Barry McCarthy.
Harry Brook was caught for 18 off George Dockrell.
Moeen hammered a six and three fours to give England a fighting chance.
Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie was named Man of the Match with a top score of 62 off 47 balls.
Balbirnie and Lorcan Tucker put on an 82-run partnership for the second wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler acknowledged that Ireland outplayed England and mentioned that the loss made it difficult for England in a tough group.
Andy Balbirnie expressed that the win against the tournament favourites was amazing and emotional.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, forcing an early finish and affecting the match outcome.
England's task gets harder as they face champions Australia at the MCG on Friday, a virtual knockout for both teams.
